isis.stitle: GENERAL INSTRUMENT ELECTRONIC PROGRAMMABLE SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER - TEST 1 - INITIAL POWER-UP TEST

svcproc.title: TEST 1 - INITIAL POWER-UP TEST
svcproc.para: Turning the key switch to the ON position causes the speedometer/tachometer unit to perform a brief self-test. The steps are as follows:

step1.para: Turn ignition key to ON position (engine does not need to be started). Observe the speedometer and tachometer pointer movement. The pointers should perform as follows:

step2.para: Both pointers will go to the nine o'clock position on the dial face for about two seconds.
Both pointers will then go to the zero position on the dial face, then advance through one complete gauge sweep.
Both pointers will then proceed to zero on the dial face in a smooth sweep before completing the test.

note.para: Gauge pointers may not complete full sweep if vehicle interior is below -10 degrees Fahrenheit. Gauges are ok.

step1.para: If neither the speedometer or tachometer pointer moves during this test it indicates a lack of B+ voltage or defective ground circuit. Perform TEST 2 - B+ Voltage And Ground Test.

step2.para: If TEST 2 is successful (no defect in B+ or ground), go to TEST 7 to isolate speedometer/tachometer defect one or more components.

step1.para: If cluster response is erratic or incomplete OR operates correctly, perform TEST 7 - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER UNIT SELF TEST DIAGNOSTICS, which is more detailed than TEST 1.
